body_html:
Hi @ezyang , thanks for the answer!
May be we just don't know something. We used to compile caffe2 with pytorch and onnx backends and got 3 separate wheels. Do you want to say that now pytorch wheel should include caffe2 as well? We're trying to build it on Ubuntu 16.04 without CUDA.

Hi @ezyang , thanks for the answer!
May be we just don't know something. We used to compile caffe2 with pytorch and onnx backends and got 3 separate wheels. Do you want to say that now pytorch wheel should include caffe2 as well? We're trying to build it on Ubuntu 16.04 without CUDA.
body:
Hi @ezyang , thanks for the answer!
May be we just don't know something. We used to compile caffe2 with pytorch and onnx backends and got 3 separate wheels. Do you want to say that now pytorch wheel should include caffe2 as well? We're trying to build it on Ubuntu 16.04 without CUDA.
